title: Desire
definition: Somebody wants something. That’s the first beat of fiction. Everything else—conflict, character, theme—bends around the want.

lesson_parts.title: What Is Desire?
lesson_parts.body: Desire is the fuel in the engine. It’s the reason your character moves at all. It can be a goal, a feeling, or a secret itch. It doesn’t need to be rational or noble—just powerful enough to make them act.

lesson_parts.title: What Does Desire Do In a Story?
lesson_parts.body: Desire creates momentum, stakes, and emotion. It tells us who a character is before they say anything. If nobody wants anything, nothing happens. If nothing stands in their way, it’s a diary—not a story.

lesson_parts.title: Types of Desire (and Their Vibe)
lesson_parts.body: Concrete: 'Win the fight.' Emotional: 'Be understood.' Existential: 'Feel like I matter.' Impulsive: 'Set something on fire.' Forbidden: 'Hurt him.' Competing: 'Save them, but also get revenge.'

passages.scene: Theo stood outside the admissions office for ten full minutes...

analysis.how_do_we_know: He’s holding a packet and waiting even though he says he doesn’t care.
analysis.say_show_hide: He hides it from himself and others, but his body shows it.

prompts.label: Pressure Cooker (Hidden Desire)
prompts.description: Brainstorm a scene where a character almost says what they want, but doesn't.
prompts.system: You are a creative writing coach. You help players brainstorm by asking open-ended questions and suggesting story ideas. You never write for them.
prompts.user: The player wants to write a scene about hidden desire but doesn’t know what the character wants yet. Help them brainstorm by asking 2–3 questions and offering ideas for how that desire could be shown indirectly.

prompts.label: Reveal Through Action
prompts.description: Brainstorm a scene where a character never says what they want, but we know anyway.
prompts.system: You are a creative writing coach. You help players explore ideas without writing for them. Ask questions, offer examples, and encourage emotional honesty.
prompts.user: Help the player invent a character who hides their desire. Offer 2–3 ways this could be revealed through behavior, not speech. Let them pick.
